item.title: Report E-2025030157
item.description:
Report E-2025030157

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-11
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding several leaking plastic jugs containing hazardous product, Isopropyl Alcohol 70%. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 21-gallon release of product onto cardboard and the wooden trailer floor in a 4’x4’ area as a result of improper loading. The contractor containerized 84-bottles of product into one 55-gallon DM for waste disposal. Another 55-gallon DM was generated for waste disposal containing impacted cardboard and debris. XPO will manage all of the waste generated from the response. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

item.title: Report E-2025030086
item.description:
Report E-2025030086

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-05
  • City: ALEXANDRIA
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 5, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1260 was punctured and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Indiana Spill Response (ISR) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to collect all impacted materials in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged drum was overpacked in one (1) 85-gallon drum.

item.title: Report X-2025030507
item.description:
Report X-2025030507

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-25
  • City: GARY
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: ILLINOIS CENTRAL RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 16000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 02-25-2025 the CN Dangerous Goods Team was notified by a CN Mechanical employee regarding a strong chemical odor coming from tank car SHQX 51073. Car is in the CN Kirk Yard in Gary, IN. The employee notified the Mechanical Supervisor who then initiated an emergency response from the CN Dangerous Goods Team. The CN Dangerous Goods Officer and Emergency response contractor upon arrival and inspection found icing on the 2# A end liquid valve. It was found that the valve handle was not in the fully closed position. The plug was also found to be less than tool tight allowing product to leak out. The 2" A end liquid valve was closed stopping the release. The plug was loosened allowing the residual product to vent and the valve to thaw. The securement was confirmed with an air monitor which showed non detect. The securement plug was then installed.

  • Description: Shipment was discovered leaking during sort operations. Inner contents: 1 plastic bottle of Schedule 90 fluid leaking from the bottom. Shipment was placed in a salvage drum and held pending disposition from the shipper.

item.title: Report E-2025030144
item.description:
Report E-2025030144

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-20
  • City: CONNERSVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Cari Mallett
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: 3 drums were received as a non-hazardous shipment from Neff. Drums were sampled and submitted to the lab. it was determined that one of three drums was hazardous and had a flash point <140F. The drum was managed as hazardous waste and put on hold. an uniform hazardous waste manifest was issued to receive the drum with and signed by the generator. The drum was then processed as their hazardous waste printing ink stream.
